alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 2:52AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Laurens and southeastern Greenwood Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 251 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Greenwood, or 6 miles south of Ninety Six Historic Site, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ninety Six, Cross Hill, Lake Greenwood State Park, Lake Greenwood, Greenwood State Park, Ninety Six Historic Site, Mountville, Kirksey, Dyson and Callison. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
